intro: Tiliacora pynaertii, commonly known as the Himalayan tiliacora, is a climbing shrub native to the northeastern regions of India and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
